revised_title: Emission of Electricity from Various Substances at High Temperatures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to investigate the electrical emission from various substances at high temperatures. They found that most materials emit considerable amounts of electricity when heated to high temperatures, with some materials, like carbon, showing a high degree of electrical emission. The study also found that the introduction of substances like alkaline earths, metals, and oxides into a hot furnace led to increased ionization currents.
